description:
# nova-manage floating delete 91.189.93.111
No handlers could be found for logger "nova.virt.libvirt.firewall"
# nova-manage floating list| grep 93.111
No handlers could be found for logger "nova.virt.libvirt.firewall"
2012-03-14 10:45:45,128 DEBUG nova.utils [req-bc597727-b224-4a51-9ffd-65f771336bf9 None None] backend <module 'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api' from '/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.pyc'> from (pid=15718) __get_backend /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:587
None    91.189.93.111   None    nova    eth1

In a similar vein, nova-manage floating create $IP also does not appear to do anything.

lamont
title: nova-manage floating delete IP doesn't delete

comments.content:
# nova-manage floating delete 91.189.93.111
No handlers could be found for logger "nova.virt.libvirt.firewall"
# nova-manage floating list| grep 93.111
No handlers could be found for logger "nova.virt.libvirt.firewall"
2012-03-14 10:45:45,128 DEBUG nova.utils [req-bc597727-b224-4a51-9ffd-65f771336bf9 None None] backend <module 'nova.db.sqlalchemy.api' from '/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.pyc'> from (pid=15718) __get_backend /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/nova/utils.py:587
None    91.189.93.111   None    nova    eth1

In a similar vein, nova-manage floating create $IP also does not appear to do anything.

lamont
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lamont

comments.content:
What version of OpenStack were you using? I think this works in Essex, but may not have worked in Diablo

These floating create/delete commands are mostly designed to take an IP range, not a single IP address - in Essex we added the ability to specify a range consisting of a single IP, but in Diablo you were required to specify a range
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~markmc

comments.content: We cannot solve the issue you reported without more information. Could you please provide the requested information ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: I can confirm that this bug no longer effects us after upgrading to Essex.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~aglenyoung
